content: While I think it’s wonderful you’re trying to be more conscious of how others may have felt in the past, I don’t think it’s fair of you to assume full responsibility for someone else feeling weak and insignificant. If you’re talking about immigrant communities in particular, very often it’s their families and ones close to them who often make them feel the same. I know it’s an uncomfortable topic to discuss, but if we want to understand why people don’t engage fully in our societies, we can’t continue to ignore the fact that the homes and backgrounds a lot of minorities come from aren’t always as warm and fostering as we’d like to imagine, and this flows over into other aspects of their lives too, particularly school and the workplace. I know you’re trying to minimize the impacts of your actions by being more aware and making sure you don’t get drunk off your power. And that’s very much needed too. I’m just trying to provide another perspective to this particular problem.
